import React from 'react'; import {connect} from 'react-redux'; import actions from './actions'; import './App.css'; //article: https://blog.bitsrc.io/react-context-api-a-replacement-for-redux-6e20790492b3 /** * With this, the connect function will now return a new component that will make the Store and Actions available to App as props. * Since I don’t have any need of internal component state or any lifecycle methods, I will write my App component as a stateless * functional component. */ /** * @render react * @name App * @description A List of DC Comics Superheroes * @example * */ function App({char, searchTerm, searchTermChanged}) { return (

DC Superheroes

A List of Major DC Superheroes

searchTermChanged(e.target.value)} />
{char.map(curChar => ( ))}
Name Alter Ego First Appearance View
{curChar.name} {curChar.alter_ego} {curChar.first_appearance}
); } export default connect(store => store, actions)(App);
